content.description:
Obscure old one from the BB. Asked MB about tweaking the name, and he suggested we call it this.

Start low on the left side of of the SW arete, and follow barn doory moves on the positive arete and top out staying on the left side of the arete.

Flows rather nicely.

Fairly soft with a sketchy landing that makes the top a bit more exciting.

bailing out right after reaching the thin juggy flake is easier.
content.protection: 5-6 pads to cover the uneven landing and the spiky boulder below
content.location: SW arete of the tall boulder on the north side of the main trail, maybe 100 yds W of the foot bridge, ~300 yds E of Hidden Forest.

content.description: Obscure old one from the BB - Start on an edge for the right about waist height on the NW arete, and a slim side crimp directly left for the left hand. Use some tricky tension and balance to find a way up to the lip, then traverse left to decent holds and top out.
content.protection: 2-3 pads - some odd rocks below, but the hard part is at the beginning.
content.location:
First boulder you come to heading S up the hill from the main trail. Maybe 50 yds W of the little foot bridge and up hill about 30 yds.

The boulders are hard to see from the main trail, but you can spot a flat spot covered in small rocks and gravel just S of the trail. Enter the woods there, and behind some smaller boulders you’ll find a good trail that continues up to Junkie Arete and Batman

Crack House is a little further up the hill on the W side of the boulder group.

If you get to the large cluster of boulders just N of the big trail, you've gone about 30 yds too far.

content.description:
Start sitting on a the wide jug below the right side of the large flake, in the middle of the face. Move up into the flake, then traverse up and left to top out at the top of the boulder.

Crux is figuring out how to transition off the flake to top out.
content.protection: Lots of pads, and spotters - we had ~8 pads to fill it all in
content.location: Middle of N face of 2nd boulder up the hill in Junkies, right behind Junkie atete

content.description:
Start with left hand on a good left facing edge in the middle of the face, and right hand on the sundercling just below it. Figure out how to pull on, then make you way up the middle of the diamond layers, keeping body to the right of the arete to the top.

Crux is pulling on and first few hand moves, then a few more fun moves to the top, gets easier as you go.

Extra star for how fun it was to develop.
content.protection: 2-3 pads - landing is a little uneven
content.location: In the woods on the south side of the trail, maybe 20 yds W of the foot bridge

content.description:
BB has a problem over here, starting low and climbing up slopers.

It seemed like starting with hands on the sloper lip was maybe ~V4 to pull on and do the first move, gets quite a bit easier from there, but movement flows pretty well.
content.protection: 2 pads, rocks are a little weird under the start
content.location: On the SW end of the boulder with Junkie Arete

content.description: From the BB - start sitting with the left hand on the crack and right hand on a small side crimp. Climb up over the bulge.
content.location: On the Crack House Boulder, which is on the W side of the boulder cluster behind the second large boulder coming up from the main trail.

content.description:
A really fun line developed by Eric Ostrander and Sam Tingy in the early 2000s.

Start sitting in the narrow pit on the right side of the boulder with left hand on a good sundercling and right on a an in cut edge.

Use some juice to pull onto the boulder and reach right for the arete. After that the hardest moves are over and you can enjoy a long, fun and occasionally tricky jug fest up the arete to the left, topping out at the top just left of the giant flake.

Exit at the crack half way up the arete is easier, but still a soft V4 with that pull on.
content.protection: Pads, pads, lots of pads and spotters ~8-12 pads
content.location: N face of the 2nd big boulder in the junkies, just uphill from Junkie Arete
